subject: Data
title: Election Prediction and Data Models
description: A 60-second lesson on Election Prediction and Data Models.

hook.text: In 2012, Nate Silver correctly predicted the outcome in all 50 US states using polling data models.

buildup.text: Election models aggregate thousands of polls, weighting them by sample size, recency, and methodology.

discovery.text: Data-driven forecasting outperformed pundits and gut-feel predictions in election after election.

twist.text: In 2016, most models gave Clinton a 70-95% chance of winning. She lost. Models aren't certainties.

climax.text: The 2016 miss taught data scientists that probability is not prediction â€” 30% chances still happen.

quiz.question: What lesson did the 2016 US election teach about data models?
